newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: SIAULIU BANK 5-MO PROFIT FALLS YR/YR.
newsitem.headline: SIAULIU BANK 5-MO PROFIT FALLS YR/YR.

text.p: Lithuanian regional bank Siauliu Bank said on Wednesday that its net profit for the first five months of the year was 740,000 litas compared to 1.8 million litas in the same period in 1996.
"The bank's net profit in May was 170,000 litas compared to 208,000 litas in April," the deputy chairman of the bank Donatas Savickas told Reuters.
"We are not satisfied with the results and plan to increase our net profit in the second half of the year," Savickas added.
Savickas also said that the bank's assets stood at 84.5 million litas at the end of May compared to 71.8 million litas at the beginning of the year.
The loan portfolio of the bank rose to 53.3 million litas at the end of May compared to 42.2 million litas at the beginning of 1996, Savickas said.
Deposits inched up to 55.3 million litas versus 42.3 million litas at the beginning of the year, he added.
The share capital of the bank is 20 million litas and subscription for a new 14 million litas issue is continuing.
The bank reported a net profit of 3.9 million litas in 1996.
